channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2024090568
item.description:
Report E-2024090568

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 had a broken seal and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and worked it in with hand tools. The 55-gallon drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack to be returned to the shipper. The impacted pallets, all UN3266 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090567
item.description:
Report E-2024090567

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon cans of UN3098 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbent pads, a Hudson Sprayer, Sodium Metabisulfite, and Soda Ash to remediate the impacted trailer interior and loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and two (2) 55-gallon drums. R+L requested for the crew to return later in the day. Three (3) additional 5-gallon jerrycans of product were damaged with approximately one half (0.5) gallon of product released to the pallet, nearby freight, and loading dock floor. Sodium Metabisulfite, and Soda Ash were utilized to remediate the site. The spent absorbents were then collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090475
item.description:
Report E-2024090475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
